intro: Wettinia disticha, commonly known as the twin-leaf wettinia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Wettinia disticha is typically found in moist, shaded environments at high elevations. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on alpine flora and plant adaptation.
